intro: Batrachium leiospermum, commonly known as the smooth-seeded batrachium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, oval seeds and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen.
